cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of Marathon, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW across the Florida Keys into the southeast Gulf, then turning northwest toward the central Gulf Coast (Mississippi-Alabama coastline) late Tuesday and Tuesday night

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama-Florida border westward to east of Morgan City, Louisiana, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from Destin, FL westward through the Mississippi and southeast Louisiana coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Tuesday night into Wednesday with a 24 % cumulative chance.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft of surge possible as peak values east of the Mississippi-Alabama border shift toward Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with locally higher totals capable of producing urban and low-lying flooding beginning late Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes in outer rainbands Tuesday night and Wednesday.
